text: Hi folks, do you know if it's possible to cash out in a market using an API call?

elements.text: Hi folks, do you know if it's possible to cash out in a market using an API call?

text: How I am cashing out in a market right now is: I send a MARKET order on every runner of the market so that the profit/loss in that runners gets to 0, but this requires to send at least an order per runner. Is there an API call that would make this automatically, as we can do in the browser?

elements.text: How I am cashing out in a market right now is: I send a MARKET order on every runner of the market so that the profit/loss in that runners gets to 0, but this requires to send at least an order per runner. Is there an API call that would make this automatically, as we can do in the browser?

text: What are you sending? And to where?

text: Aha I was successful now :slightly_smiling_face:

text: I succeeded this way: Sending a POST Request to url=<https://cashout-service.betfair.com/cashout-service/transactional/v1.0/cashout> with parameters: appKey, marketId, quotePercentage=100 (for a 100% cashout) and quoteValue=X (where X is the value shown in Betfair when cashing out)

elements.text: I succeeded this way: Sending a POST Request to url=
with parameters: appKey, marketId, quotePercentage=100 (for a 100% cashout) and quoteValue=X (where X is the value shown in Betfair when cashing out)

text: Looks like quoteValue is a Mandatory Parameter, which sucks because you have to know it beforehand... Any idea how to get this number through the API?
